column4: I'm running the Dapper livecd right now and I want to access some files on a local HD. The partitions on the hd show up in Nautilus but trying to open them doesn't work. I tried umount'ing them and that doesn't work either. Any ideas?
Mount doesn't show that they're mounted at all, which is strange
if you unmonunted them, did you re-mount them
what message does it give, what command did you type
umount means 'unmount' which means they are no longer accessible
Trying to open them in nautilus gives error: device /dev/hda1 is not removable, error: could not execute pmount
Right. I was going to unmount them and mount them manually to see if that would work
Running mount gives: mount: /dev/hda already mounted or /home/ubuntu/Desktop/HD busy
Ahhh, it works now. I had to select a partition ;)
